recipes.title: Lemon Raspberry No Bake Cheesecake Bites

winePairing.pairingText: Port, Moscato d'Asti, and Cream Sherry are great choices for No Bake Dessert. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port.

productMatches.title: St. Barthelemy Cellars Merlot Port
productMatches.description: With its bright and shimmering regal red color, the Merlot port is pleasing to the eye. Soft legs cling to the glass and the nose conjures up nougat and caramel with a hint of blackberry. A smooth mouth-feel gives way to a burst of spice while hints of licorice and blackberry are followed by a finish of almonds. Enjoy this delightful port with pâtés, chèvre and nutty cheeses.

recipes.instructions: Line a 13" x 9" baking sheet with a parchment paper. Set aside.Place raspberries and cream cheese in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.Add sugar and zest and blend well.Scrape the cheesecake mixture into a medium mixing bowl. Place graham cracker crumbs into a small bowl.Scoop the mixture with a small cookie scoop or a tablespoon and roll in cracker crumbs.Set on the prepared sheet.Refrigerate for about 1 hour. Serve.Refrigerate leftover bites in a ziploc bag or an air tight container.

steps.step: Line a 13" x 9" baking sheet with a parchment paper. Set aside.
Place raspberries and cream cheese in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
Add sugar and zest and blend well.Scrape the cheesecake mixture into a medium mixing bowl.
Place graham cracker crumbs into a small bowl.Scoop the mixture with a small cookie scoop or a tablespoon and roll in cracker crumbs.Set on the prepared sheet.Refrigerate for about 1 hour.
Serve.Refrigerate leftover bites in a ziploc bag or an air tight container.
